bioghist.p: Rachel Simon (b. 1959) is an American writer of both fiction and nonfiction. She graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1981, and published her first book, a collection of short stories, in 1990. Simon is the author of the nonfiction book Riding the Bus With My Sister: A True Life Journey (2002), a novel, The Magic Touch (1994), a collection of stories, Little Nightmares, Little Dreams (1990), and The Writer's Survival Guide (1997). Her essays, stories and commentary have been widely published in periodicals. Simon teaches courses at Bryn Mawr in fiction and nonfiction writing.

scopecontent.p: The papers of Rachel Simon include drafts of stories and screenplays, various published editions of her works, academic papers, many personal journals, magazine and newspaper articles about her works, tapes of interviews, and other recorded materials. The collection also includes administrative records from Simon's undergraduate and graduate years, such as student loan forms and applications for grants and teaching positions.
